text.p: Comprehensive Environmental Systems Inc said Tuesday it has been delisted from Nasdaq because of allegations in recent indictments against a former chief operating officer and counsel of the company.
The company, however, said it will seek a review of the Nasdaq delisting.

The indictments against Leo Mangan, the company's former director and chief operating officer, and James Nearen, a director and counsel, relate to alleged securities fraud, stock manipulation and non-disclosure of past criminal records in prior filings with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission and Nasdaq.
Comprehensive Environmental previously said both men left the company on September 12. The company also said it immediately stopped making payments to Mangan.
The company said it remains optimistic about its prospects and its core operations and business fundamentals remain strong.
